alert.note: Alert for Pecos (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 8:34PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN PECOS COUNTY THROUGH 915 PM CDT... At 834 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Fort Stockton, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Stockton, Firestone Test Track, Fort Stockton-Pecos County Airport, Coyanosa, Imperial Reservoir, and Imperial. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 237 and 292. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
